text:
Something strange suddenly  started happening with Tomcat at startup. Not sure 
as it seems almost random. Still persists after reinstalling it from the Zip. 
examples.war.bak is a backup of examples.war as I then update examples.war to 
add new servlets.

I'm sorry I cant add any useful insight as I am new to Java, Tomcat, Servlets. 
There is no reference to any of these 'contexts' in server.xml in the conf 
directory. I have searched my machine - the only references are in the 
automatically generated files. Is there any encrypted or registry info used by 
Tomcat? I can email any of the affected files, or the whole Apache and Tomcat 
environments if required.

2001-03-12 01:52:07 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx( /examples )
2001-03-12 01:52:07 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx( /admin )
Starting tomcat. Check logs/tomcat.log for error messages

creator: 106350.3660@compuserve.com

text:
Tomcat tries to automatically expand WAR files in the webapps directory and 
then automatically adds contexts for all directories it finds.  You don't need 
to add contexts to server.xml unless you need to assign non-default attributes.

It looks like you've got some unwanted files and directories under your webapps 
directory.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
